Examples: RNA Sequencing of Lung Cancer Samples 2021

Description: Alias of the dataset. Must be unique. Can be the GEO identifier such as GSE12345, or a DOI. No Greek Letters.

Examples: This dataset contains RNA sequencing data from 200 lung cancer samples, including gene expression profiles and patient clinical data. It is designed to study differential gene expression and mutation burden across tumor stages.

Description: The overall design of the dataset.
Examples: 'Cross-sectional' to compare gene expression in healthy vs. tumor tissues, or 'Time-series' to observe changes during treatment.

Description: The url of where the dataset is stored.
The Digital Object Identifier (DOI) associated with the dataset.
The assay the dataset is representative of. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
The species the data was collected on. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
The tumor type(s), if applicable, of the data collected on. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Tissue type(s) associated with the dataset. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
A list of file formats associated with the dataset. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Examples: "AVI, BAI, BAM, BED, CDS, CHP, COOL, CSV, DAE, DB, DS_Store, FASTA, FASTQ, FCS, FIG, FREQ, GCG, GCT, GCTx, GFF3, GTF, GZIP Format, HDF, HDF5, HTML, IDAT, JPG, JSON, LIF, MAP, MAT, MATLAB script, MSF, MTX, PDF, PNG, PZFX, Python Script, R File Format, RAW, RDS, ROUT, RPROJ, RTF, SGI, SRA, STAT, TAR Format, TDF, TIFF, TSV, TXT, VCF, WIG, XML, ZIP, bed12, bedgraph, cel, cloupe, docx, mzIdentML, mzXML, pptx, rcc, xls, xlsx, MGF, BIGWIG, H5AD, H5, SF, PKL, BPM, Unspecified, Pending Annotation, maf, CLS, SCN, SVS."

Description: The denormalized manifest for dataset submission.
Grant number(s) associated with the dataset's development. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
The PubMed identifer(s) associated with the development of the dataset. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
A unique primary key that enables record updates using schematic.
